meanings.definition: A small, crusty or scaly patch on the skin
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the scur on my arm.
meanings.sent2: She applied ointment to the scur to help it heal.
meanings.sent3: The scur on his knee looked like a tiny mountain.
meanings.sent4: The scur on the tree bark resembled a miniature desert.
meanings.sent5: The scur felt rough to the touch, like tiny pebbles.

meanings.sent1: The cat tried to scur across the room without being noticed.
meanings.sent2: I saw a mouse scur quickly into its hole.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel scurried up the tree, trying to hide its acorn.
meanings.sent4: The shadows seemed to scur along the walls in the dim light.
meanings.sent5: Time seemed to scur by as we raced to finish the project.

meanings.sent1: He's such a scur, always causing trouble.
meanings.sent2: She realized he was a scur when he betrayed her trust.
meanings.sent3: The scur tried to cheat his way out of trouble but failed.
meanings.sent4: The villain in the story was portrayed as a scur by the author.
meanings.sent5: The scur's actions spoke louder than his empty words.
